Description: Glazed composition (faience) amulet of Anubis; mould-made and covered with a blue glaze (mostly worn away); perforated for suspension at the shoulder; human figure with a jackal head standing on a low plinth.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Curator's comments: For other examples of Anubis pendants from Amathus, see Clerc 1991, 97 and passim. Another example occurs in the sanctuary at Kition-Kathari (Clerc et al. 1976, 118). Lagarce (in Clerc et al. 1976, 167-74) provides a useful overview of the use and significance of Egyptianizing amulets and scarabs on Cyprus which often differ from those found in Egyptian contexts. Bibliography: Clerc G. 1991, 'Aegyptiaca', in eds V. Karageorghis et al., La nécrople d'Amathonte Tombes 110-385. V (Nicosia), 1-50. Clerc G. et al. 1976, Fouilles de Kition. II. Objets égyptiens et égyptisants (Nicosia).
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 117, Tomb 31)
